name: Roasted Cauliflower and Radish with Mustard, Nigella, and Fennel Seeds
description: This recipe is super-easy and addictive. Fennel and nigella seeds give the vegetables an Indian pickle flavor profile. Roasted cauliflower is always a hit, and here you can try roasted radish as well. I like to use baby red radishes because they make the dish look so colorful. Serve this with Northeastern dals such as odia dal or cholar dal, and with spicy curries that use fennel seeds. (Recipe from https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/1941252095/vegric-20 Copyright © 2015 by Richa Hingle.
recipeIngredient: 15 to 18  small red radishes (sliced (2 to 3 cups))
1 tablespoon safflower or other neutral oil
1 teaspoon red pepper flakes (or to taste)

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 425°F / 220ºc. Place the cauliflower and sliced radish in a large bowl. Add the oil and rub lightly to coat.
recipeInstructions.name: Preheat the oven to 425°F / 220ºc. Place the cauliflower and sliced radish in a large bowl. Add the oil and rub lightly to coat.

recipeInstructions.text: Pulse the fennel, mustard, nigella seeds, pepper flakes and salt to a coarse mixture in a spice grinder or blender. Add them to the vegetables and toss well. Spread the vegetables on a parchment-lined baking sheet.
recipeInstructions.name: Pulse the fennel, mustard, nigella seeds, pepper flakes and salt to a coarse mixture in a spice grinder or blender. Add them to the vegetables and toss well. Spread the vegetables on a parchment-lined baking sheet.

recipeInstructions.text: Bake for 25 minutes or until the cauliflower is golden and tender to your preference.

recipeInstructions.text: Garnish liberally with cilantro and lemon juice before serving.
